title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Assassin's Creed Origins follows Bayek of Siwa on a breathtaking journey through ancient Egypt, blending history and myth with gorgeous visuals and captivating storytelling. The vast, open-world is rich with detail, from the sunlit deserts to the streets of Alexandria, offering a deep sense of exploration and discovery. Bayek is driven by personal loss and a desire for justice, making his journey emotionally engaging. Both expansions of AC Origins, 'The Hidden Ones' and 'The Curse of the Pharaos', breathe new life into Bayek's journey, expanding his world with depth and wonder, making his story even more unforgettable. Overall, Origins is a beautifully crafted experience that no one should pass up on

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Have a hard time playing the game because of the useless app called Ubisoft Connect(Uplay). I don't know why do I need to install that piece of crap in order to play this game. They are very eager to pump up the users of Ubisoft Connect that they don't even know that its back firing. Tell me, what is the necessity of the Uplay App? I don't even have friends in your platform, I only have friends here in Steam so I don't see the point why I need to run your lame app in order to play this game? It is very hassle to me because Uplay doesn't run properly. Once I close the game and run it again the Uplay will bugged out and I need to reinstall that shitty app every time I play so that's why I decided to refund the game here in Steam so that I can buy other games that don't require 3rd party software in order to play the game. Shame on you UBISOFT!!!

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
After 100% completing this game I must say this is a 9/10.
Pros:
[list]
[*]It got beautiful graphics despite being 7 years old
[*]The story felt was actually quite interesting and got me loving the characters (most of the time)
[*]The open world felt meaningful and immersive and not just cluttered with random unnecessary side quests
[*]The DLCs despite not containing that much more of a story were just gameplay wise really fun
[*]This being the first of the RPG games it left you the choice between going for the full slaughterhouse combat style whilst still providing you with the tools to stealthily do all of it if you want
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*]Level requirements for Story Missions. I've found myself having to do not a lot but at least 2-3 side mission before being able to complete the next Story mission which felt really anticlimactic if you're fully immersed in the story.
[*]Bugs:
    - I couldn't play the Trial of the Gods missions the first couple of weeks. This was a known issue on Ubisofts side and 
       they've just recently fixed it
    - I still can't play some extra missions like: A GIft From the Gods, Here Comes a New Challenger, Incoming Threats and 
       Lights Among the Dunes and I haven't even tried to submit a support ticket because the last time I did they gave me a 
       generic ass answer after 5 days or smth
[/list]

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Its grindy. It was fun at first but now I am somewhere 60% through the game and I'm bored. I prefer to finish games but I also don't want games to feel like work and this one currently does. The story is pretty meh, nothing special. Typical assassins creed. The gameplay is alright but not amazing. The setting is cool as well but shallow and it also gets old. 

Its cool at first, so if you get a good sale do that. Its a fun setting for a while until it all becomes incredibly repetitive.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Really good open world assassin's creed game. After this is where they went down hill for me. One of the main cons for me in this game are the damn prices for DLC. $40?! thats a whole nother game. What stopped me from playing more and getting all the achievements. ill just wait for a sale to eventually happen

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Started playing and after 6 hours realized how artificially extended this game is (and started doing everything just to finish it and have a right to brag about this shit)

Boosted character to skip the grind and follow the story which turned into "we have to add a lot of fillers because this is a big game!" So not only the levels are just lazy way to extend the game, the cutscenes and story parts are also there to just make the game feel longer.

I enjoyed riding through Egypt and did some world activities but I did like 20 of them. I know that I would get sick of them if I wanted to do 100% due to recycled content.

World feels pretty dull and dead. Do not try to defend it because "it's desert what do you expect?" 

- I expect to see the budget in the game actually. 
- I expect to not see 6 guards standing on one spot looking like clones. 
- I expect NPCs not to fall from the sky in front of me when spawning. 
- I expect not to have cutscene, then giving me a control for 10s and then having another one. 
- I expect to play offline when I buy something. 
- I expect to enjoy the world rather than set the autorun feature and go make some food while camel is running 3km into area I didn't explore but I know that devs knew only idiot would buy this game and they won't kill me. 
- I expect my health not to regenerate. #WolverineOrigins
- I expect to be an assassin and not a murderer blinded by revenge.
- I expect some logic behind breath bar when diving into water, why is it here, when I do not need to care about it?
- I expect some complexity and not "Evil INC" kind of story.
- I expect raising difficulty to be more than adding more health.
- I expect devs when trying a new things to actually make them fun, the boats were just another way to extend the gameplay.

- I expected something different when reading "Best Assassin's Creed RPG attempt"

I didn't expect my casual gamer wife saying "Meh this game looks so.. bland" by world and gameplay design! Even she could see the shit painted with gold. God help us all..

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Seems like an anomaly for Ubisoft to make something interesting these days, but they've actually managed to create something great here.  I didnt care for the story, the start is slow and boring, but after awhile the story actually does get better and better. Ending with one of the best endings in the series. They also kept the momentum going with 2 high quality DLCs, which were by far my favorite parts of the game.
The worst part of the game is the level system, if you go 30 seconds into a region that has enemies higher level than you, you get 1 shot by literally all enemies. The system sucks and it locks you out of exploring. Even the story missions has a recommended level, which forces you into doing garbage for hours. The sidequests were boring for the most part so I just skipped a lot of them, but the DLC ones were surprisingly good.
All in all worth playing just for the ending & the DLCs, without a doubt the best one since Black Flag

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Assassin's Creed Origins is a great game with a great story who’s held back from going from “a great game” to “a timeless classic” by a weak narrative last arc and a repetitive gameplay once you’ve attained the higher levels. 
It's still a really good game with beatiful environments and a really good cast of characters that are sublimed by a voice acting as close as perfection as it can get.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: An enjoyable addition to the assassin's creed franchise, pleasant cinematic experiences and engaging combat, a well rounded adventure rpg.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: These games are so close to being good but doing so much assassinating kills the mood. You're admittedly doing what the game title says but it feels way too casual the way you go around having to kill people to complete objectives. It needs more types of missions entirely or more ways to complete already existing missions.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
After the pointlessness that was Rogue, the "neket iadet" that was Unity and the mediocrity that was Syndicate, we finally get this, which is, in terms of an Assassin's creed game, the closest thing we could get to a masterpiece. Now, don't get me wrong, this game still carries a lot of faults including the new combat system, which despite offering a refreshing approach of freedom can be infuriatingly inconsistent at times (I advise anyone to begin this game on the easy setting to start with. You can change the difficulty at any point you feel you need more of a challenge from the combat) but this game gave me everything I ever realistically expected as an AC fan and the game delivers so much choice and option to tailor your preferred experience of it.

The series is finally given the overhaul it desperately needed and this flourishes all the better for it and it's difficult to pick an aspect of it that fails to entertain. I've loved every minute of it. I'm a little biased with the setting, I admit, due to my love for ancient Egypt but it felt a perfect location to kick start the creed and in many ways I see this game as a reimagining or even a reboot of the series as much as a prequel. It's root influence is Black Flag providing plenty of stalking zones for stealth. Chuck in some HZD, a pinch of the Witcher and an overall feel of the original Tomb Raider (In my personal top 5 of all time) and you essentially have the components that make this game what it is.

Bayek, the lead character, is briliantly portrayed and a massive improvement on the cardboard cutouts from previous installments and his altruism propels you through a gargantuan story which is nothing short of epic in scope charting the power struggle in Egypt for thier independance from Romans, Greeks and thier own Pharaohs. The more I played, the more I liked and the further up the AC ladder it got. In fact, I think I have a new favourite. Thank you, Ubisoft (Never thought i'd say that...)

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: The developers should be condemned to work in the mines for the absolute ASS audio balancing. If you want to enjoy the ambience, prepare for skull-shattering crowd noises. Absolutely fucking mind blowing that there's only an option to boost dialogue volume, none to lower it from the absurdly loud default.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
**Assassin’s Creed Origins: A Breathtaking Journey Through Ancient Egypt**

"Assassin's Creed Origins" takes the iconic franchise to new heights with its rich storytelling, expansive open world, and captivating reimagining of Ancient Egypt. From the very first moment, you're immersed in a vibrant world filled with historical detail, stunning landscapes, and engaging characters.

The protagonist, Bayek, is one of the most compelling heroes in the series. His personal journey, driven by love, loss, and revenge, adds a deep emotional layer to the game. The interactions with historical figures like Cleopatra and Julius Caesar are well-written and seamlessly woven into the narrative, making you feel like a key player in one of the most important periods in history.

Visually, the game is a masterpiece. Whether you're exploring bustling cities like Alexandria, scaling the majestic Pyramids of Giza, or wandering through the vast deserts, the attention to detail is breathtaking. The dynamic weather, lighting, and wildlife bring the world to life in a way that few games manage to achieve.

Gameplay-wise, "Origins" introduces a refined combat system that feels fluid and responsive. The RPG elements, with skill trees and customizable gear, add depth to the experience, allowing you to tailor Bayek’s abilities to your playstyle. The side quests are well-crafted, offering meaningful stories that are more than just filler content, further enriching the game’s world.

The exploration of ancient tombs, solving puzzles, and uncovering the mysteries of the First Civilization are incredibly satisfying for fans of both history and the series’ lore. The Discovery Tour mode is a fantastic addition, offering a unique educational experience that makes Ancient Egypt even more accessible.

Overall, "Assassin’s Creed Origins" is a triumphant return for the franchise. It blends action, history, and storytelling in a way that is both entertaining and educational. Whether you're a long-time fan or new to the series, this game is a must-play, offering an unforgettable adventure through one of history’s most fascinating eras.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Second AC game, first was Unity. I completed Unity and i must say that Unity is a better assassin game, i prefer the combat mechanism there, and you dont get as much fancy tools and weapon in Unity (simplicity is the best, and no i did not unlock any extra consumable tools in Origins' skill tree).

But, Origins is a good game too, maybe not so much as an assassin game, it's a mix of open world RPG and assassin game.
You can still play like a assassin or going SPARTAAAA, but overall 'assassin' style gameplay is quite easy... im playing Origins in normal diff and i find it (infiltrating and stealth killing) easier than Unity. Personally, I find the close combat quite clunky, but is still acceptably good.
 
Origins got better plot that I can very well immerse myself in. You can feel the angers and sadness from them characters. There are quite a lot of side quests and there are, well, similarities at times but not totally repetitive.

Minor bug is when in rocky area with uneven surfaces, you can easily get stuck and having a hard time running around. Another thing is that the level mechanism making you dealing little to no damage to high level enemies while they can kill you in 2 attacks. Well that in the end it does not matter.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Despite being a old game i realy enjoyed it.The timeline and the scenery of egyptian civilization is very beautiful in game.But the game for some reason do not support the animas hack mod,reda chest and reda quests.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Despite being seven years old, the game's graphics are really good. The story isn't groundbreaking, but it's good enough to make me grow attached to the characters—at least most of the time. The open world feels immersive and meaningful, avoiding the trap of being filled with pointless side quests (although I mainly focused on the main story).

As a fan of the original Assassin's Creed games, I found this title strikes a solid balance between RPG elements and classic AC gameplay. While I encountered a few bugs (like ships or enemies popping out of nowhere and getting stuck), none of them were game-breaking. However, the level scaling of enemies sometimes felt bad, as it could take an absurd number of hits to defeat them. I think playing on the max difficulty probably contributed to that too!

Overall, the game feels like a prototype for AC Odyssey on the RPG side of things. If you find the game on discount, it's definitely worth picking up. I'll share more thoughts on Odyssey in a separate review after finishing the story.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Absolutely beautiful game, beautiful story, not many problems with it (in terms of bugs which are very rare.)
However parkour could have been much better, there is many places where direct movement and freedom could have been utilised.

9/10

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Un juego bueno dentro de la serie, historia llamativa , combate mas activo, ambientacion excelente tanto en banda sonora como en gráficos, lo malo es que el mundo abierto es muy repetitivo.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Assassin's Creed Origins is my first series game I decided to join after has enough money to buy it.

After I finished the prologue, I realized that I in love with this game already. The characters design with their unique personality, Open world map, The way sidequest is more interesting more than Storyline, and relationship between father-son. this is absolutely MASTERPIECE.(plus i love hot men and women.)

Worth a price (∞/10)

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Good game and good story.

Side mission still good, but because this game have a lot of mission, they dilute main game story.

Gameplay still good, but I think combat is not good enough compare with other RPG game. We can play with stealth style (almost time I stealth kill because combat with a lot of army is take long time).
Some weapons style is hard to use. I only use some weapons.

The first DLC is not good enough (this just like side missions in main game) but the second DLC is very good.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Get it on sale but it was a solid 100 hours of content if you do the side quests, more of an RPG than a AC game but still fun. Slap on "enemy auto leveling" and you wont feel overpowered until max level.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
This is my first game of the franchise and I think it is quite good.

The world is gorgeous. The animation is fluid. The story is compelling.

However, there are some drawbacks. The game play is average. The map is too large. Quests are repetitive.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I was wrong, I bought this game a long time ago like it's been  5 to 6 months since I bought it at first I didn't liked this game bcoz of the hate for RPG games  but today I was so bored I finished rdr 2 , last of us 1 , ghost of tshushima , uncharted series and etc... just played this game for 5 hours I'm in love with this game and story ❤️ IMO the greatest assassin's creed game of all time !🛐

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I bought the game legitimately, and now the wandering merchant doesn't sell any boxes anymore. It's so frustrating!

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
-------------------
Ubisoft is evil
-------------------

STOP GIVING your money to Ubisoft. In the latest patch, in 2024, Ubisoft suddenly deleted Heka Chests, the player-friendly lootboxes purchased using 3000 INGAME gold PURPOSELY. After finishing the main game, 2 DLCs, i installed a previous version reverting mod from Nexus called "Restore Heka Chests". Got really cool weapons but they're useless because i already beat the game.

No buying helix credits too, they shut down the store. Using 700 helix credits from season pass, I spent them on the First Civilization Pack and Swordfish weapon during the 50% sale. wait for that before you spend the helix credits to get the best value. 

---------------
Censorship
---------------

After using Photo Mode and taking photos of nude women (yes i admit it's weird), the game stops sending me the latest event quests "Trial of the Gods" where one fights 3 Egyptian gods Sobek, Anubis and Sekhmet.

Don't you think it's really stupid to shadowban a player for just using an ingame feature? I did not mod the game, the nudity is there BY DEFAULT.

------------
Difficulty
------------
Started my game on Normal. but later switched to Nightmare for the main game's final arc. Nightmare enemies are very dangerous especially animals, they are immune to stunning and can keep attacking. Leopards can easily destroy you. For human enemies, just spam Smoke Screen or keep dodging and use cursed weapons. Cursed weapons give you 200% more damage but forces your hp to 33%, worth it.

Smoke Screen is usable even when dodging, which gives you time to assassinate enemies before they even detect you.

For the best experience, Hard difficulty is best. the more advanced AI is only active in Hard or Nightmare. Hard is good for the average person who doesn't enjoy dying too often.

--------------
Gameplay
--------------

Compared to the previous game AC syndicate, The combat is really good. Bayek is best with a Normal Sword, Sickle Sword and Spear. His attacks feel forceful and fierce. Not recommended to use axes, clubs or staffs, these weapon types are bad. Sleep darts put opponents to sleep and Smoke Screen stun opponents. It makes you invisible. use while staying still and BEHIND COVER, before enemy sees you.


Overpower attacks are the most fun mechanic because you can reliably 1HKO enemies or severely injure them. the shield helps to block arrows, in the past AC games "AC Unity", Ranged Enemies kill you easily. a shield fixes the problem.

Archery is awesome. Predator bows: high damage and high range. Light bows: good for chipping enemies. Hunter bows is balanced. Warrior bow is a shotgun but too situational, wastes arrows too easily. It requires 2 perks and a headshot to deal good damage.

------------------
Environment
------------------

"I don't like sand" - Anakin Skywalker. Many places are boring and ugly. Egyptian temples are the main attractions, they are the coolest structures. This game takes place during Old Egypt's final days. The Pharaohs are Greeks. Bayek and his Egyptian people are the target of systemic racism from the Greeks. I'm depressed to see Egypt falling apart.

-----------
Parkour
-----------

MUCH BETTER than AC Unity and Syndicate's parkour but worse than AC1 to AC Rogue. Parkour is more dangerous again because you can accidentally fall to death, higher realism contrasting AC Unity & AC Syndicate.

-------------------
Achievements
-------------------
Achievements are really simple except for 2.

1) Archeologist: "Complete all tours in the Daily Life category" I REALLY HATE that Ubisoft forced the player to finish 20 tours for 1 silly achievement.

2) Reduce, Reuse, Recycle: "Sell 100 trinkets at once." ONE MUST sell 100 unnecessary items AT ONCE to get this achievement, it means losing out some gold for early game to upgrade your weapons. ANIMAL GOODS DO NOT COUNT.

Got all 67 achievements, 162 hours.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Probably top 5 worst games ive ever played. Combat is a shitty souls like and its either the easiest fight or a 3 hour beat down (3hp a hit on enemies with 1000hp)  if you want to fight someone with 4 lvls higher than you. Terrible parkour, "I'm just gonna sit here and die I guess beacuse fuck moving" type shit

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Overall a very bland and boring experience. 
Voice actor for Bayek was excellent, graphics and especially the scenery were extraordinarily good, but its basically a huge thinned out map with fetch quests.

And worst of all, it is just a Ubisoft open world hack and slay game that they put a assassin's creed skin on. 

In its core it has nothing to do what the Assassin's Creed is about even though they tried to shift it somehow in the end to make it fit the story. But really, it's not an AC.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Great game, great graphics, compelling story. By far, my favorite AC map and definitely in my top 5 open-world maps. I'm a sucker for open-world games. When I love the game, I tend to do all the side missions. I haven't finished the game yet, but I want to take a moment to praise this game's side content. I understand that the game restricts main missions when you're under-leveled. It didn't impact me much because I found the side content compelling, and most of it ties into the main story. What's even more surprising in Origins is that some of the side missions have mo-cap performances, and some even feature their own corridor assassination sequences, something that cannot be said for the more recent games in the franchise.

Many others have said they find it annoying that they can't assassinate some enemies with a single strike; however, it's not as bad as many claim. The only characters I couldn't assassinate with one strike were the bounty hunters. Other than that, I was always able to finish off any enemy with one hidden blade strike.

The last thing I want to address is the story and music: they are amazing and beautiful. Bayek might be my favorite AC protagonist ever, and the voice actor did a tremendous job. Overall, I love the game. It's my favorite AC game since Black Flag. 9.5/10.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I've played this OVER 500 hours, but it no longer loads.  Both Origins and Odyssy.  I have tried a number of things, but nothings changes.  This game was excellent when it was working correctly.  Neither STREAM nor Ubi soft has done anything to improve the situation.  And why have both games gone south at the same time?

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Its a solid game with a good story, although i found it quite grindy, having to constantly do side quests, just to be able to follow the main quest. Also, I'm not the biggest fan of the combat system, AC Odyssey really shows a huge improvement on that front. 

Otherwise, beautiful world and super immersive!

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
By all metric, this is the last "good" AC game and here is why:

1. The story still cares! Yeah I know! An AC game that actually respects the lore, and tries to set something up. Unlike the clusterf**k that is Odyssey and the brainrot that is Valhalla, Origins' story remains grounded in history and paints an interesting portrait of a character that is still beloved by the community. While the origin of the creed does not come about until the DLC releases the base game story is still for the most part carried by believable characters, dialogues and world events. I'd say do the side quests for as much as possible because they too help flesh out the narrative.

2. The gameplay is basic, streamlined. But put into the proper context, this is the first game in the series that lets you soft roleplay by picking and choosing between different types of gear. It features a dynamic open world full of things you can do and interact with. While in retrospect it did kickstart a regression in the franchise in terms of animation, writing, movement and world-design quality, when this game came out it felt like a breath of fresh air after almost a decade of playing the same game set in the same cities. Considering it to be the "last" proper game in the franchise almost turns it into a kind of reward that you get for sticking with the franchise for so long. It is a love letter to the franchise as much as it is an attempt at trying something new.

3. The world is simply something to behold. I love the colour palette, the varied looks of ancient Egypt depending on which region you are in. I love the Graeco-Roman cities full of NPCs doing things. I almost wish I hadn't played Odyssey, Valhalla and Mirage because so much of those games were just copied-and-pasted assets from Origins. And you can't "unsee" what had been copied and pasted which cheapens the entire experience of playing Origins. We thought it was the beginning of something marvellous and edificial...turns out, by the time we got our hands on Origins, Ubisoft had already reskinned this game into two other versions slated to come out in the next 5 years.

Ultimately I like the game for what I remembered it to be, a new spin on an old franchise and formula that in 2017 was desperately in need of a soft reboot. What it ends up becoming, however, is something that saddens me as a longtime AC fan, but also, entirely unexpected.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: love the graphics the gameplay super fun all round nice game with plenty of quests and progression to complete great grinders game and a quick game if you want story only highly discounted at the time of review for sure worth thee price which at the time for me was about 12 dollars or so

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I have Enjoyed this game since i picked it up on sale on Steam playing it on PC Game Pass for 2 weeks before that

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Well, well, well...AC: Origins. The first full Action-RPG in series and it is truly a new begginning. Like many said, devs inspired by The Witcher 3 in many ways. This is not bad, just as a matter of fact. 

I was enjoying exploring ancient Egypt, though to the end I was freaking hating these outposts.  Too many repetitivity for my liking. If not for my strange decision to 100% the game I'd probably not be bored to the end. 

The story is lovely and I'm very pleased with the main character. I can feel Bayek, his motives and I undertsand why he is making this or that decision. Really worth the time and money spent on it.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Whether you like Assassin's Creed, Egypt or beautiful open worlds to explore and play pretend in, this game has you covered! I haven't played an AC game since AC3 so I wasn't aware that the series turned into more of a typical RPG, and I'm totally down! You can go in guns blazing or play it stealthy, you're call! 

Tldr; 10/10 would buy again

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
1 years ago i already played AC 4 Black flag, but the gameplay not likely my style, then i bought this AC origins, and the gameplays are my style, i love to go around the maps, i like the storyline, sidequest, etc. 
for me, this is perfect

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Had fun playing. Lots of awesome game scenery to see in an interesting historical period. Wasn't as enamoured with the gameplay/story as other releases, such as the original or Ezio titles. Playing this game after Odyssey was probably a mistake on my part as it felt like Origins went backwards slightly.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Cool story, (I mean protagonist not the shitty part about animus)
Doing all activities on the map + DLC is suffering.
Getting overheating achivment is a peace of shit.
Fuck ubisoft.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
First quest:
-Go to a location (5 minutes of riding, because the world needs to be MASSIVE)
-Assasinate two guys (with no interesting strategy, because we were too worried with making the world MASSIVE to actually design fun stealth locations, and DLC bow just oneshots anything anyway)
-Watch another soldier casually walk over corpses of his buddies (because we couldn't figure out how to make enemies react to dead bodies in 2017)
-Retrieve a cropse, put it on my camel, set it on a path to objective, watch youtube for five minutes when it delivers a corpse (world is HUGE, reminder)
-Watch another 3 minute cutscene that delivers nothing outside of "soldiers bad"
-Refund the game, feel better

Assasin's Creed wasn't good since Black Flag and at this point we just need to accept it.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: First AC game i played and i thoroughly enjoyed it. racked up 109hrs of play time with all the DLC. ran great on the steam deck!

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I love this game and the story of the game but if you get the dlc part of it is broken (Trial of the Gods) it will fix only for about one week then break all over again which will only come back after around a month for the full rotation so there is no hope for the community to meet the goals.  Ubi has been aware of this for 3+ months with multiple people putting in tickets.  They even removed a quests to get weapons that would normal be cash purchase for free due to what ever bs reason they want to give us.  Save your money and just say no or play for the story.  I would suggest to just google the story and read the plot and move on as they don't seem to want to fix it.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: The very first assassin's creed that introduces the RPG system which is a controversial take on the ac franchise, some fans loved it and others hated it. The question is did it delivered?.... YES! it did, the game introduces the beautiful terrains of Egypt from roaming the desserts and its pyramids, walking around the city of Alexandria and exploring hidden temples. Assassin creed origins delivered on how the RPG system works on the franchise while still maintaining the Assassin creed identity, unlike Odyssey and Valhalla... The game itself is beautiful and I love how the game feels authentic and historically accurate which made the game more fun and better and I might say this is by far one of the great AC game and personally my favorite on the franchise and the very last GREAT AC GAME.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: This assassins creed is interesting from its others in the franchise before. The story and progression through the game is really good. I recommend playing this

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
This game proved to me that bigger is not always better. The main story was fairly bad. You are repeatedly forced to play a second/third character who really detracts from the story. The main character at times speaks slowly with a thick accent as English is not their first language. The result is boredom and confusion. The characters are just not that interesting. Far too many quests force you to walk slowly beside someone until you are then free to go. Bad development decisions poisoned what could have been a far more enjoyable game. No doubt they are still with the studio so it will continue project after project. 
 
Ubisoft needs better writers and directors for their games. There are far too many fetch quests which always need 3 things and then return. Hiring actual children actors would work much better than using women who clip their voices and pretend to be young. Their voices will start to get on your nerves every time you enter a location and hear their same lines. 

The two DLCs were well done in part but suffer in one way or another. Get them and the base game on sale. I can't imagine who paid full price for this slop and walked away thinking it was great. It's a 6 out of 10 game for me and a slightly raised thumbs up.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: Truly one of my favorites title from the franchise, Origins really did well in the exploration and the campaign, the setting and world building is just chef kiss. For the campaign, at first the start is slow and boring, but after awhile the story actually does get better and better. Ending with one of the best endings in the series. The DLC is actually very good too, especially the Hidden Ones who put the first foundation as The Assassin to fight and prevent the Order of the Ancients before transitioning to The Templars, the cons are the price, only buy this game when discounted, and the grindiness of the leveling the character and weapons.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: 10/10 Absolutely amazing! The story, the gameplay, the limited bugs, the game crashed only once! Not only was this game fun to play but this an important story to the AC series. I will be playing this agian!

I went on the Ubisoft website to submit a ticket to get it fixed but it won't submit tickets without me being logged in. There is an option to submit without logging in but this just says "there was an error submitting your case"

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
[h3] Assassin's Creed Origins: A Breathtaking Journey Through Ancient Egypt [/h3]

[i] Assassin's Creed Origins [/i] takes players on an epic journey through ancient Egypt, a world filled with wonder, danger, and adventure. The game introduces us to Bayek, a Medjay, whose quest for revenge takes him on a journey through a richly detailed world of political intrigue, ancient mythology, and thrilling action.

One of the most notable aspects of [i] Assassin's Creed Origins [/i] is its stunning graphics and attention to detail. The open-world environment is vast and immersive, with intricate designs and fascinating historical details in every corner of the map. From the towering pyramids to the bustling cities, everything in the game feels meticulously crafted and thoughtfully designed.

In terms of gameplay, [i] Assassin's Creed Origins [/i] makes significant changes to the series' traditional mechanics. Combat has been overhauled to be more challenging and strategic, and the introduction of a skill tree system allows players to tailor Bayek's abilities to their preferred playstyle.

The story of [i] Assassin's Creed Origins [/i] is compelling and emotionally resonant, with Bayek's journey providing a satisfying blend of revenge, justice, and personal growth. The game's side quests are also engaging and often tie into the larger narrative in meaningful ways.

Overall, [i] Assassin's Creed Origins [/i] is an excellent addition to the series, offering a richly detailed and immersive world to explore, exciting combat, and a compelling story. Fans of the franchise and newcomers alike will find much to enjoy in this epic adventure through ancient Egypt.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: as someone who LOVED ancient egypt stories/movies, I greatly enjoyed this game. I even got the DLCs when it was on sale. though i just couldn't beat cleopatra. the world building exploration was amazing, though i found the pyramids exploration part to be a little draggy.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Assassin's Creed Origins is one of the greatest entries in the franchise. The game transports you to ancient Egypt with a breathtakingly beautiful world and a gripping story that keeps you hooked until the end. Bayek's journey is powerful, and the ending literally gives you goosebumps.

The combat is refined and engaging, and the world is packed with secrets and history that make exploration a joy. This game reinvigorates the series while delivering an unforgettable experience.

Rating: 9.5/10

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: i hadnt played since 3 because i hated that they killed off desmond (oops spoiler alert lol, sorry) but i saw this and odyssey on sale for a ridiculously low price so i bought them, i havent played odyssey yet but this game really renewed my love for the series, and the fact that those who came before and the future timeline are huge parts of this game, i really have a lot of hope for this series moving forward

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
"Papo? Jump." Who's cutting onions!?

I picked up this game a few days ago and just wrapped up the main story, what a ride! It took me right back to the feels I had when Ezio found Altair's body in the library. I'm not exaggerating when I say I loved every bit of it. The setting, the massive world to explore, the side quests, it was all top-notch!

That said, the ending did feel a bit rushed, like most AC games. I was really hoping we'd get to assassinate Cleopatra since she turned out to be such a backstabber. Exploring the pyramids and those creepy, dark tunnels was a blast too.

It hit me hard when Bayek and Aya had to part ways to start their own brotherhood, and it's even sadder knowing they end up buried in the same cave! Their love story was one of my favorite parts. I also wish we got more time playing as Layla in the present-day scenes.

Still have the DLCs to dive into, but overall, this game was 100% worth it!

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
If it was possible, I'd give this game a neutral review. The story starts great, but toward the end becomes subpar, so I made a great effort to finish the game. As in the next parts of this series, the gameplay quickly becomes repetitive consisting of the same tasks over and over again.

The redeeming features are game's setting in Egypt, which is kinda cool, and, of course, graphics.

P.S. This one is still much better than Odyssey.

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
Hey! I just played Assassin’s Creed Origins and it’s super cool! 😄

You can be an awesome assassin with hidden weapons, fight like a brave warrior with swords, or shoot arrows from far away. 🗡️🎯 Plus, you get to ride a camel and use your pet eagle to scout from the sky! 🦅🌟

The game has amazing places to explore and tons of secrets to find. It feels like being in a thrilling action movie where you get to choose how you play! If you love sneaking, fighting, and exploring, this game is perfect! 🎮👋

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review: I was good but not good as old assassin game

title: Assassin's Creed Origin
review:
[h1] BEST AC GAME EVER MADE (YES ,I PLAYED EVERY AC GAME TWICE THOROUGHLY) [/h1]
[b] ORIGIN > ODYSSEY (VALHALLA IS GARBAGE) [/b]
[b] EXCEPT MISSION MENU EVERYTHING IS SIMILAR TO THE PREVIOUS AC GAMES. SO THERE SHOULD BE NO HATE REGARDING THIS GAME SAYING THAT ''OLD AC GAMES VS NEW AC GAMES ''[/b]
[u] THIS IS AS MUCH AC GAME AS IT SHOULD BE [/u]

LET ME EXPLAIN ----
GAME MAP - 80 SQKM VS AC BLACK FLAG 145 SQKM . SO NO NEW OPEN WORLD THEORY.
SHOP - JUST LIKE AC 2 OR BROTHERHOOD, DIFFERENT SELLER NOT LIKE ODYSSEY
ARMOUR -  NOT SO RPG , JUST LIKE ANY PREVIOUS AC GAME WHERE SPECIAL PARTS CAN BE UPGRADED BUT OUTFIT DOESN'T.
MAP LEVEL - JUST LIKE SYNDICATE
WEAPON -  KINDA LIKE UNITY 
UI SOUND - MIX OF PREVIOUS AC GAMES

REVIEW -  I SAID BEST BECAUSE OF THE FOCUS OF THIS GAME. THIS GAME IS PERFECT FOR HISTORY LOVER. THE ENVIRONMENT THEY SET IS PERFECT.ALL PREVIOUS AC GAMES DID GOOD ABOUT THIS BUT THIS GAME DID WAY BETTER.YOU CAN INSTANTLY FEEL THAT YOU ARE IN THAT ERA.(I PERSONALLY FEEL THAT I WAS IN ANCIENT INDIA SPECIALLY BENGAL). BUILDING STRUCTURES, ROOFS, CORP FIELDS,EARTHEN ROADS, MUD HOUSES.TEMPLES,MARKETS.
AND OVERALL EGYPT...THEY CREATED THAT TIME AS NEARLY PERFECT AS THEY COULD. EVEN IN EMPTY DESSERT , I CAN WALK FOR ETERNITY.

FIGHTING, ARMOURS, WEAPONS - NOT SO GREAT BUT NOT BAD EITHER,IN ONE WORD YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED 

STORY AND CHARACTER - I WON'T REVEAL FOR SPOILER BUT ...DAMN GOOD ...NEED SEQUEL ...AND THE CHARACTER....WE SAW THAT TYPE AFTER LONG TIME...AND YOU CAN EASILY COUNT HIM ON TOP TIER AMONG OTHER ASSASSINS

GRAPHICS - AS 2017 GAME IT IS BEAUTIFUL . 9/10 RATING ON 2024 STANDARD.(MAX SETTINGS)
I PLAYED AND COMPLETED THIS GAME TWICE (CRACK+BUY) ON HARDEST DIFFICULTY AND TOOK MY TIME. I DIDN'T FIND ANY GAME BREAKING BUG OR GLITCH.

DLC- DECENT STORY AND GOOD ADDITION

TOUR GUIDE - 10/10. BEST ADDITIONAL FEATURES FOR ME. REALLY LIKED IT

SOUNDTRACK - 9/10 , SPECIALLY EZIO THEME ON MENU AND MAIN OST IS JUST AWESOME 

IF YOU STILL HATE THIS GAME FOR JUST BEING IN THE NEW AC LIST . PLEASE PLAY AGAIN AND GIVE SOME TIME TO THIS GAME , I ASSURE YOU THIS GAME DOES NOT DESERVE THAT HATE WHICH ORIGINATE PROBABLY FROM ODYSSEY OR VALHALLA

TIP - IF YOU LIKE TO ENJOY THE GAME WORLD THEN WHEN YOU ARE NOT IN MISSION , TRY TO WALK SLOWLY (EASIER WITH CONTROLLER) INSTEAD OF RUNNING. YOU WILL FIND A NEW PERSPECTIVE OF THAT WORLD.
